title.narrative: OP 4 : Communication for Development (C4D) - SOCIAL BEHAVIOUR CHANGE/COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT & EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, National institutions and local authorities enable the population, especially the most vulnerable, to exercise their rights with regard to health, nutrition, and access to water and sanitation, in order to realise the democratic dividend and achieve the SDGs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: In 2021, Madagascar faced multiple humanitarian crises including COVID-19, plague, polio, drought, and cyclones. Children were among the worst affected during these crises.Against this backdrop, UNICEF as the co-leader of Communication Group supported the Government of Madagascar with Communication for Behaviour Change of children and their families. Young people were engaged in community communication activities as key agents of change and influencers in ;their communities and families. They we involved in capacity building on essential family practices and are sensitized about their rights to demand necessary services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
